title: virasog
author: virasog
content: Look like mainstream media trying to put fear in people mind and they trying to give fearful statements about crypto even when it is not related to crypto and bitcoin. See this example, The Winklevoss twins are in a big mess—and it has to do with cryptoThis has nothing to do with crypto and they are trying to project that this bad may affect the bitcoin prices.This things indicates that prices are being suppressed because of these news and they will blast very soon. Get in the train before its too late.

comments.author: Doan9269
comments.body: As long as every has the right to use their mouth and speak whatever they wishes doesn't mean we must pay attention to every media distractions fto a low entity citizens about what they frot concerning bitcoin price, being an experienced bitcoiner who has many years of engaging into buying and selling of bitcoin, familiar with the blockchain technology, knows well the bitcoin protocols and concensus that guide the price and every transactions and you know the difference between bitcoin and altcoin, someone shouldn't come on an open day light to cook up some lies for you about what determines the bitcoin price, you work by what you know and have discovered not what they say.

comments.author: UmerIdrees
comments.body: Quote from: virasog on February 01, 2023, 02:47:02 PMLook like mainstream media trying to put fear in people mind and they trying to give fearful statements about crypto even when it is not related to crypto and bitcoin. See this example, The Winklevoss twins are in a big mess—and it has to do with cryptoReal bitcoin investors already know that media is always manipulated and it should be used intelligently to predict the price of bitcoin. Usually, what is being told, the opposite of that actually happens.Media is usually controlled by the whales, and retailers just believe these media stories because they believe in these new agencies. I am not saying that we should stop reading these media stories but i would say to use them as an indication for the price movement.

comments.author: jackg
comments.body: I was wondering why most of that article was behind a pay wall but its probabky because they don't have any good articles to put behind one... Their subscriptions also sound like a precursor to them becoming an mlm (pyramid or ponzi scheme) or something too (something crypto seems to be rid of for the most part).Most articles that mention bitcoin are just tagged to get higher viewership (even good newspapers are normally mostly talking about web3 coins or exchanges/companies in crypto).

comments.author: NeuroticFish
comments.body: Quote from: virasog on February 01, 2023, 02:47:02 PMLook like mainstream media trying to put fear in people mindThere are multiple things here:1. Some wealthy entities are buying bitcoin happily at this price levels. They may be paying for defamatory / FUD articles.2. Under the hood there may be some sort of "exchanges war". In the same way Binance has given the last push to FTX and spread some FUD on Coinbase (iirc), I would not be surprised if some exchange tries to "give a push" to Gemini.3. Governments and central banks have their own anti-bitcoin agenda. Just they are trying to be careful, since if they hit bitcoin too hard people may also perceive badly the yet-to-come CBDCs.But we know already that we don't have to get scared of each and every news, don't we?

comments.author: Edwardard
comments.body: Quote from: virasog on February 01, 2023, 02:47:02 PMLook like mainstream media trying to put fear in people mind and they trying to give fearful statements about crypto even when it is not related to crypto and bitcoin. Mainstream media should never be taken into consideration for any investment decision. They are full of baseless shit. I remember they were all talking about "BTC: the next big thing on earth" at 60k levels. But now changed opinions at 20k lol.Quote from: virasog on February 01, 2023, 02:47:02 PMThis things indicates that prices are being suppressed because of these news and they will blast very soon. Get in the train before its too late.Agreed. I'd say buying at any prices around here would do if you plan to stick with it for the next 10years .

comments.author: pawanjain
comments.body: Tell me something new, LOL. Mainstream media is an attention seeker and crypto has a lot of attention in the market   .When the media doesn't have anything new to talk about, they find out something related to crypto and brings it into limelight.We all know the amount of scams related to crypto. There's always something happening in crypto.This is why the media can't get enough of it and keeps talking trash about it.

comments.author: Lucius
comments.body: Quote from: virasog on February 01, 2023, 02:47:02 PMLook like mainstream media trying to put fear in people mind and they trying to give fearful statements about crypto even when it is not related to crypto and bitcoin. I will correct you, they are not trying to do anything you think, but they are trying to get more subscribers - because as others have noticed, the article is locked and I assume that you haven't read it either, because the news that you think is relevant is actually already old news that has been discussed on the forum for some time.Who thinks DCG / Genesis / Grayscale / Barry are bad actors?Quote from: virasog on February 01, 2023, 02:47:02 PMThis things indicates that prices are being suppressed because of these news and they will blast very soon. Get in the train before its too late.Who cares what Silbert, the twins and various other crypto messiahs are doing, because they are just fighting for another billion more on their account. It's never too late to board the train you mention, and the ticket costs as much as you're willing to pay - which means that the rich don't decide who will ride with them.

comments.author: Findingnemo
comments.body: Quote from: virasog on February 01, 2023, 02:47:02 PMLook like mainstream media trying to put fear in people mind and they trying to give fearful statements about crypto even when it is not related to crypto and bitcoin. See this example, The Winklevoss twins are in a big mess—and it has to do with cryptoThis has nothing to do with crypto and they are trying to project that this bad may affect the bitcoin prices.This things indicates that prices are being suppressed because of these news and they will blast very soon. Get in the train before its too late.There is no wonder with such manipulation because they have been doing the same for years and will be keep doing it as long as they can. It won't affect the price of Bitcoin that much in my opinion cause most of the bitcoin investors may know what is this related to so the only thing is it will create fear among the non bitcoiners who think bitcoinis not good for investment.

comments.author: sunsilk
comments.body: That isn't brand new. Ever since that bitcoin and its market has been established, countless times FUD were made and even if the actual news doesn't have something to do with it, they're making their articles relevant.But as we know when these FUDs are made, I guess that we're seeing the sign that the bull run is soon to come. It's more worrying when they start to praise the market as the opposite of it might occur. Just always remember that.

comments.author: AverageGlabella
comments.body: I thought the  The Winklevoss twins were old news now they claim to have invented and been the 1st to everything. They might have been telling the truth about Facebook but them being involved in bitcoin is no more news worthy then your average joe. The news are still using their name to try and increase clicks but as you say this has nothing to do with btc and should be ignored and not clicked on so that these news people do not continue posting these types of stories with clickbait titles.

comments.author: solehdavid
comments.body: The Italian scientist Galileo Galilei said 385 years ago that the Earth revolved around the Sun. He was put to death because his ideas were considered wrong by the church. this situation is no different today, no matter how much you do the right thing, as long as these truths are against the interests of some people, they will continue to denigrate it. something inevitable is only delayed, but one day it will definitely happen

comments.author: KiaKia
comments.body: This type of news should means nothing to old crypto investors because we've seen this too many times in the past years, honestly, I have grown too tired of bad news about crypto because it's a buying tool for the manipulators, this is nothing more than pure price manipulation, only crypto newbies should be disturbed by such news.

comments.author: avikz
comments.body: All major media houses are run by big corporations and these big corporations are run by bank's money. So it's no wonder that they will try to defame crypto market. We are seeing such attacks since a long time now. So those who are familiar with cryptocurrency in general, they know how to ignore such things. The challenge is with the new people who have not been exposed to cryptocurrency.But the only silver lining is that their impacts are temporary and the market is slowly gaining immunity against such defaming attempts.

comments.author: akuntester1
comments.body: Sometimes we don't need to bother with all the negative information like that, it will only make our mental health worse.For people who already know and understand cryptocurrencies, they may not really pay attention to the negative views that arise from that information.But for people who don't know or don't even know cryptocurrencies, it can exacerbate and add a negative view of cryptocurrencies.We know that in this world not everyone is able to properly and correctly sort out and digest all the news that is informed.From the various information reported by all current information media, be it online media or physical media such as newspapers.Sometimes it seems to me that all the information media is really like a "double-edged sword" trope.I mean all topics of information that are reported can raise the positive value of the topic or can even bring down it with a negative view of the topic of the news.Quote from: jackg on February 01, 2023, 03:28:43 PMI was wondering why most of that article was behind a pay wall but its probabky because they don't have any good articles to put behind one... Their subscriptions also sound like a precursor to them becoming an mlm (pyramid or ponzi scheme) or something too (something crypto seems to be rid of for the most part).Most articles that mention bitcoin are just tagged to get higher viewership (even good newspapers are normally mostly talking about web3 coins or exchanges/companies in crypto). I agree with what you said, most information media is sometimes only concerned with getting a large audience.By trying to take advantage of something that gets the attention of many people like crypto and Bitcoin.But not really that concerned with what the content of their articles.

comments.author: buwaytress
comments.body: I keep telling you guys: it's okay.We're happy when Superbowl's flashing around all the big bucks on big stars talking up crypto, when we see crypto ads on Wall Street, Times Square, right? And most of the time, none of it has anything to do with crypto (most ads aren't even allowing you to own any coins or interact with blockchains, for example). Might as well allow the FUD to keep squeezing out the fear.

comments.author: hugeblack
comments.body: I see that the bad news is much better than the good news because it is a sign that the bear market is over and more low prices are an opportunity for you to buy more before Bitcoin moves to rise again.Therefore, I will be happy with all this FUD, unless this FUD carries false news or misleading articles. As for biased articles, this is the nature of the central media.Why do they do this? I am not a fan of conspiracy theories, but I think they know little about Bitcoin and digital currencies, because ignorance is what drives them to write such articles.

comments.author: aoluain
comments.body: Quote from: sunsilk on February 01, 2023, 04:10:02 PMThat isn't brand new. Ever since that bitcoin and its market has been established, countless times FUD were made and even if the actual news doesn't have something to do with it, they're making their articles relevant.But as we know when these FUDs are made, I guess that we're seeing the sign that the bull run is soon to come. It's more worrying when they start to praise the market as the opposite of it might occur. Just always remember that.yea its nothing new, for my whole Bitcoin life I have been hearing negativity fromthe media.I know the Winklevoss twins but I dont follow them, and I'm certainly not going to pay to find out what shitcoins they were involved in to cause their trouble.The way I read that headline is that if it was Bitcoin which caused their trouble theheadline would read that way but it doesnt.

comments.author: Rruchi man
comments.body: Quote from: virasog on February 01, 2023, 02:47:02 PMLook like mainstream media trying to put fear in people mind and they trying to give fearful statements about crypto even when it is not related to crypto and bitcoin. Who controls the mainstream media? Mostly the government or individuals that have very close ties with the government. You can't expect less in their efforts to defame bitcoins and endorse their controlled CBDC. There are just a few media houses that give trustworthy reports these days and unfortunately most of them are not so popular and do not have as much influence as the other media houses that have strong affiliations to the government and are under their control and influence. Their plans will fail in a long run.

comments.author: SatoPrincess
comments.body: I watch the news but I don’t believe a word they say, it’s all propaganda to keep the masses in control. See how hard they are blowing up the FTX scandal, they want to make the disgraced SBF the face of crypto. I believe that which I can see in my immediate environment. This article is a lazy attempt to spread FUD, there are people who wouldn’t read the contents and just assume from the headlines that crypto is a mess.
